TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit HashAlgorithmName extends System.ValueType implements class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName>

Docs.summary: Specifies the name of a cryptographic hash algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The HashAlgorithmName structure includes some static properties that return predefined hash algorithm names, as well as a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.Name%2A> property that can represent a custom hash algorithm name as a strongly-typed string. Hash algorithm names are case-sensitive.
Asymmetric algorithms implemented using Microsoft's CNG (Cryptographic Next Generation) API interpret the underlying string value as a [CNG algorithm identifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa375534.aspx).
Asymmetric algorithms implemented using other technologies:
- Must recognize at least "MD5", "SHA1", "SHA256", "SHA384", and "SHA512".
- Should recognize additional CNG identifiers for any additional hash algorithms that they support.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure with a custom name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The constructor performs no validation on `name`.

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance and a specified object are equal.
Docs.returns: if is a object and its <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.Name%2A> property is equal to that of the current instance. The comparison is ordinal and case-sensitive.

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for the current instance.
Docs.returns: The hash code for the current instance, or 0 if no value was supplied to the constructor.

Docs.summary: Gets a hash algorithm name that represents "MD5".
Docs.value: A hash algorithm name that represents "MD5".

Docs.summary: Gets the underlying string representation of the algorithm name.
Docs.value: The string representation of the algorithm name, or or <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> if no hash algorithm is available.
